newsitem.title: USA: MBNA prices $750 mln of credit securities.
newsitem.headline: MBNA prices $750 mln of credit securities.

text.p: MBNA Corp said Wednesday that its MBNA America Bank NA subsidiary has priced $750 million of seven-year floating rate credit card asset backed securities.

The transaction, Series 1997-C, included $637.5 million of Class A senior floating rate asset backed certificates, $56.25 million of Class B subordinate floating rate asset backed certificates and a $56.25 million privately placed floating rate collateral invested amount.
The Class A certificates accrue interest at 11 basis points over the one month London Interbank Offered Rate, or LIBOR, the company said.
The Class B certificates accrue interest at 30 basis points over the one month LIBOR.
Both Class A and Class B certificates were priced at par. The transaction is scheduled to close March 26.
MBNA is a bank holding company with $39.6 billion in managed loans. It said it is the country's second largest lender through bank credit cards.
